articles.title: Congress Faces Setback As Kisan Morcha State VP SP Bhardwaj Joins AAP Ahead Of Delhi Polls
creator: ABP News Bureau
articles.description: In a major setback to the Congress ahead of the high-stakes Delhi Assembly elections, the party's Kisan Morcha state Vice President S.P. Bhardwaj on Thursday joined the Aam Aadmi Party.AAP Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Singh welcomed Bhardwaj into the party with the a party scarf and cap at the AAP headquarters. Bhardwaj has withdrawn his candidacy from Najafgarh and extended his support to AAP candidate Tarun Kumar, Singh said."Before the Delhi elections, the AAP family continues to grow stronger! Congress Kisan Morcha Vice President S.P. Bhardwaj has joined the Aam Aadmi Party today. He has withdrawn his candidacy and extended his support to AAP candidate Tarun Kumar. Rajya Sabha MP @SanjayAzadSln welcomed S.P. Bhardwaj into the Aam Aadmi Party," AAP announced in a post on X, sharing visuals from the press conference.‡§¶‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§≤‡•Ä ‡§ö‡•Å‡§®‡§æ‡§µ ‡§∏‡•á ‡§™‡§π‡§≤‡•á ‡§≤‡§ó‡§æ‡§§‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§Æ‡§ú‡§º‡§¨‡•Ç‡§§ ‡§π‡•ã‡§§‡§æ AAP ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§∞üôå‚ù§Ô∏è‡§ï‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§∏ ‡§ï‡§ø‡§∏‡§æ‡§® ‡§Æ‡•ã‡§∞‡•ç‡§ö‡§æ ‡§ï‡•á ‡§â‡§™‡§æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑ S P Bhardwaj ‡§ú‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§ú ‡§Ü‡§Æ ‡§Ü‡§¶‡§Æ‡•Ä ‡§™‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ü‡•Ä ‡§ï‡•á ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§Æ‡•á‡§Ç ‡§∂‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§≤ ‡§π‡•Å‡§è‡•§ ‡§â‡§®‡•ç‡§π‡•ã‡§Ç‡§®‡•á ‡§Ö‡§™‡§®‡§æ ‡§∏‡§Æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§® AAP ‡§ï‡•á ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§∂‡•Ä Tarun Kumar ‡§ú‡•Ä ‡§ï‡•ã ‡§¶‡•á‡§ï‡§∞ ‡§ö‡•Å‡§®‡§æ‡§µ ‡§∏‡•á ‡§Ö‡§™‡§®‡§æ ‡§®‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§≠‡•Ä ‡§µ‡§æ‡§™‡§ø‡§∏ ‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§π‡•à‡•§‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∏‡§≠‡§æ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ç‡§∏‡§¶ @SanjayAzadSln‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/N0MBU4TuSi‚Äî Aam Aadmi Party Delhi (@AAPDelhi) January 30, 2025 During the event, Singh, while welcoming the former Congress leader into AAP, said: "Today is a very special day as Congress's Kisan Morcha state vice-president S.P. Bhardwaj is joining the Aam Aadmi Party. Before Congress, he had also held several positions in the BJP. This time, he had filed his nomination from Najafgarh for the Delhi Assembly elections, but he has now withdrawn it in support of AAP candidate Tarun Yadav. I welcome him to the Aam Aadmi Party."ALSO READ: 'Yamuna Ammonia Issue Should Not Be Mixed With Poisoning Claims': EC To KejriwalHe further said that Bhardwaj has decided to work for the AAP after he was inspired by the policies laid down by former Delhi CM and party supremo Arvind Kejriwal. Singh also said that Bhardwaj would help AAP strengthen its hold in Najafgarh and the surrounding areas.The former Congress leader also expressed happiness on joining the AAP and assured that he would dedicate himself to the party and work for the welfare of the people. "It is a matter of great fortune for me to return to my family after 12 years. I am inspired by the way Arvind Kejriwal is serving the people of Delhi and working for the city's progress. That is why I am joining the Aam Aadmi Party. I will dedicate myself wholeheartedly to working for the party and the welfare of the people," he said.Voting to the 70-member Assembly in Delhi will be held in a single phase on February 5. The counting of votes will be done on February 8.ALSO READ: 'Can Haryana Poison Water Modi Drinks?': PM Slams Kejriwal Over 'Poisoning' Yamuna Claim, Says 'AAP-da Rattled'

articles.title: Ex-Rebel Chief Ahmad Sharaa Named Syrian President, Assad-era Baath Party, Army & Parl Dissolved
creator: News18
articles.description: Syria's de facto leader Ahmed al-Sharaa has been declared president for the transitional phase on January 29, Syrian state media reported. Sharaa was appointed "as the country's president in the transitional phase", state news agency SANA reported, quoting military official Hassan Abdel Ghani. The report added that Sharaa would also represent the country "in international forums." Sharaa was tasked with forming "a temporary legislative council... until a permanent constitution for the country is decided", SANA news reported. Syria's constitution was also suspended and the existing parliament dissolved, according to reports citing commander Hassan Abdel Ghani. n18oc_world n18oc_crux 0:00 INTRODUCTION2:28 SYRIA AUTHORITIES ‚ÄúDISSOLVE‚Äù ALL ARMED FACTIONS3:35 ‚ÄúFALLEN REGIME HAS LEFT DEEP WOUNDS‚Äù5:08 WHO IS SYRIA‚ÄôS NEW PRESIDENT, AL-SHARAA?

articles.title: UAE travel tips: How to save up to 22 per cent on flights by booking at the right time? Check HERE
articles.description: Travel hacks for saving money on air travel include booking on Sundays for savings on international flights, flying on Thursdays for lower costs, and traveling in January for the cheapest economy tickets. Did you know that while Sunday is the most cost-effective day to book a flight, it is also the priciest day to fly? The day of the week plays a significant role in both booking and traveling. According to the 2025 Air Hacks Report by travel brand Expedia, released on Tuesday, "travelers can save an average of 16% by booking on a Sunday compared to Friday, but they can end up paying 16% more by flying on a Sunday rather than Thursday." This insight comes from an analysis of global air ticket data, in partnership with the Airlines Reporting Corporation and data provider OAG. Here are some travel hacks to help you get the most value for your money. Booking on Sundays can help travelers save an average of 16% on international flights compared to booking on Fridays. For those looking to book premium class seats, waiting until the weekend can result in savings of about 22% compared to booking on a Thursday. To maximize savings, it's best to book international flights six to 12 days before departure. Travelers who booked during this window saved an average of 21% compared to those who booked 128 to 138 days in advance, which turned out to be the least cost-effective time to book. Travelers departing on Thursdays save an average of 9% compared to those flying on Mondays, which is typically the most expensive day to start an international trip. Flights between 9 pm and 3 am are 8% less likely to be canceled compared to other times, while afternoon flights (3 pm to 9 pm) have a 20% higher chance of cancellation compared to night flights. Cancellations are least frequent in June and peak in April. January is the most affordable month for economy tickets, with travelers saving up to 13% compared to June, the most expensive month for economy travel. July offers the best deals for premium tickets, with savings of up to 14% compared to October, which is the priciest month for premium fares. Traveling on Tuesdays tends to offer quieter airports. While not always the cheapest day to fly, it's an ideal option for those seeking a more peaceful travel experience.

articles.title: India News | Punjab Govt Issues Clarification After Delhi Police Seizes Cash, Liquor from Car with 'Punjab Sarkar' Written on It
articles.description: Get latest articles and stories on India at LatestLY. With Delhi Assembly elections less than a week away, Delhi police seized multiple liquor bottles and cash from a car which had multiple Aam Aadmi Party pamphlets and 'Punjab sarkar' written on it. The Punjab government has issued a clarification stating that the registration number on the vehicle is "forged and fake" and it does not belong to any state government employee.
